title: Overall Spreads Remain Tight Even As Oracle Debt Risk Jumps
description: On "Bloomberg Real Yield", Maureen O'Connor, global head of high-grade debt syndicate at Wells Fargo Corporate & Investment Bank, and Amanda Lynam, head of macro credit research at BlackRock, talks with Matt Miller about credit spreads, issuance and risks tied to the boom in AI growth. There’s a frenzy of development going on to support the AI revolution, and with it an insatiable demand for debt to fund it. Some estimate the overall infrastructure roll-out cost could reach $10 trillion, and with so many lenders lining up to throw cash at the assets, the fear is a bubble is building. (Source: Bloomberg)
